channel.title: My C++ Equation Program
channel.description:
I started this program as a way of staying awake during math. Basically, it solves and checks very simple algebra equations, such as x + a = b, x - a = b, ax = b, ax + b = c, x(a+b), etc. It's not very complex, but it works, and has integer and decimal modes. I compiled it in Dev-C++
The code is a little out of order (the exit function is in the middle :p), and it's not all commented yet, but I am still working on it. The code's too long to copy paste, but I'm attaching it. Any suggestions or comments would be nice.

item.title: My C++ Equation Program
item.dc:creator: @sparkz sparkz
item.description:
@sparkz wrote:

Not bad, but needs better error handling. For example, when asked if you would like to use decimal mode, and you enter ‘g’, the program crashes. I would also recommend std::cin.ignore() and std::cin.get() instead of making a system call to pause the program. Other than that, good job (Y)
